intro: Passovia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted passovia, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Passovia bracteata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
